item.title: Nominal Nonlinear Model Predictive Control
item.description: Nominal Nonlinear Model Predictive Control The code in this repository is a basic nonlinear model predictive control (NMPC) implementation in Python with soft constraints, which uses an Unscented Kalman filter for state estimation. The NMPC algorithm does not consider possible uncertainties and is therefore referred to as nominal. For more information on the required modules and packages refer to section Technical requirements. If you found this code useful, consider citing [1][2] that use this implementation for verification purposes.

item.title: Model-Predictive Control
item.description: Vehicle model linearization Vehicle model is $$ \dot{x} = vcos(\phi)$$ $$ \dot{y} = vsin((\phi)$$ $$ \dot{v} = a$$ $$ \dot{\phi} = \frac{vtan(\delta)}{L}$$ State and Input vector: $$ z = \begin{bmatrix} x-position \\\ y-position \\\ velocity \\\ yaw-angle\end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} x \\\ y \\\ v \\\ \phi\end{bmatrix} $$ $$u = \begin{bmatrix} acceleration \\ steering-angle \end{bmatrix} = \begin{bmatrix} a \\ \delta \end{bmatrix} $$ ODE is $$ \dot{z} =\frac{\partial }{\partial z} z = f(z, u) = A’z+B’u$$
